p: Céspedes et al. [ 60, 66] carried out assays to investigate the phytotoxic properties of compounds from different Cedrela species, on germination, root, and shoot development, and the respiration of seeds of two monocots ( Lolium multiflorum and Triticum vulgare) and two dicots ( Physalis ixocarpa and Trifolium alexandrinum). With similar methodologies, these studies differed mainly in the compound tested, bioactivity-guided isolation [ 66], and verification of possible effects on the photosynthesis system presented by Céspedes et al. [ 60].
